docs.text: i can already feel the hate letters pouring in on this one , folks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i loved the wedding singer .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but it gets worse .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: if i so much as mention titanic in the same sentence .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: hell , same paragraph as the wedding singer , i'm bound to be lynched .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: well lynch me then , because i thought adam sandler and drew barrymore had the most convincing chemistry in recent memory , with titanic as the only exception .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: right away , you're ready to discount my review , aren't you ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: you're thinking that i can't possibly know what i'm talking about .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after all , this is adam sandler right ? ? ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: well , there's more .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: i actually got choked up , and more than once .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: yes , the man who brought us billy madison and happy gilmore was able to bring sincere tears to my eyes .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but before you shrug me off as an imbecile , i urge you to see the movie and see for yourself .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the wedding singer is the story of robby hart ( sandler ) , a 1985 rock star wannabe whose soul achievement in life has been performing cover tunes at wedding receptions for the past five years or so .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but when his own wedding results in a no-show for the bride ( angela featherstone as linda ) , robby begins to re-examine his life , and wonder why true love doesn't exist for people like him .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in the process of performing at these receptions , robby meets a waitress named julia , played with wholesome sweetness by drew barrymore , whose reputation is anything but this character .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: julia too is engaged , and when robby finds himself without a wife , his free time allows him to help her plan her own wedding , seeing as how her fiance , the " miami vice " loving glenn ( matthew glave ) , doesn't seem all that interested .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as the time goes by , we learn the reason glenn is do dispassionate about the wedding - he's merely marrying julia to prevent a breakup , something he wants to avoid even if he does sleep around with tons of other women .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's obvious that robby is going to fall for julia and feel a strong need to rescue her , but what is a lighthearted romantic comedy for ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this isn't sleepless in seattle , but i'd actually compare it to that before i'd compare it to happy gilmore .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while the wedding singer maintains some of that post-snl cornball humor , its sincerity and charm carry it a very , very long way .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sandler is great in his role , and yes , if you allow it , you can take him seriously .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: barrymore seems perfect along side him , and although the two more likely represent gen-x moronism and party-girl ditzism ( respectively ) , the two go together like bread and butter as a mid-eighties couple .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: one scene in particular , where julia ponders the future in a mirror , is so well done , i was on the verge of tears .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: unfortunately , sandler is going to make a lot of people shrug this one off as a no-brainer , but it's got so much surprise substance packed inside that i'm encouraging everyone to go see it .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: in fact , the entire theater applauded when the film ended , and laughs were so consistent , some jokes were probably missed due to the uproar .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the 1985 setting was milked for everything it was worth , and for those of us that are old enough to remember it , it was a bodacious trip back ( and done very well ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: sandler shows a new side to himself while maintaining all his original charm ( or is it anti-charm ? ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: while the wedding singer only deserves three stars due to artistic merit , grading it on pure enjoyability would give this one four stars .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's hilarious , and it's touching .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's got that great cheezy humor , but it also takes sandler to a higher level than anyone expected .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is one to see again and again .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: is it possible the wedding singer could be one of the sweetest romantic comedies of 1998 ?
docs.label: positive

docs.text: my " magic 8-ball " predicts it is certain .
docs.label: positive
